text: A survey probe returned with footage of a structure that should not exist — then went silent.
A station mutiny has sealed the docks; the only way in is through maintenance crawls.
A hymn transmitted from deep space is rewriting personalities on multiple habitats.
A local government is selling relic claims to pay war debts — maps may be forged.
A trade lane appears safe on charts but is haunted by 'insurance' pirates.
Terraforming mirrors are drifting; if they collide, the sky becomes a weapon.
A harmless microbe on one world is lethal on another. Quarantine politics turn violent.
An ancient legal AI has reactivated and is issuing binding judgments via drones.
A perfect eclipse reveals signals etched into the star's corona — only for minutes.
A navigation rift offers impossible travel times, but something counts the ships.
A democratic habitat's election is being hacked by physical sabotage — the ballots are air.
Two factions claim the same derelict megaship; boarding teams are already inside.
